sentence.Network_en: He is too worldly - wise to expect too much of human nature.
sentence.Network_cn: 他太世故了,所以对人性无多奢求.

sentence.Network_en: Be wisely worldly , be not worldly wise. ( Francis Quarles )
sentence.Network_cn: 要善于处世, 不要老于世故. ( 夸尔斯 )

sentence.Network_en: She appears to be naive, but actually she's very worldly - wise.
sentence.Network_cn: 她看似单纯, 其实很成熟.

entry.tran: 练达的;老于世故的；老成稳重的
entry.def: If you describe someone as worldly-wise, you mean they are experienced and know about the practical or social aspects of life, and are not easily shocked or impressed.

means.word_mean: 1. experienced in and wise to the ways of the world
